title: Touchpad Not Working
description: Fix laptop touchpad not responding or cursor not moving.

steps.title: Check if Touchpad is Enabled
steps.instruction: Try pressing the touchpad toggle key (usually Fn + F5, F6, F7, or F9 depending on laptop model). Look for touchpad icon on function keys.

steps.title: Enable in Windows Settings
steps.instruction: Settings → Devices → Touchpad → Make sure touchpad toggle is ON. Check 'Leave touchpad on when mouse is connected' if needed.

steps.title: Update Touchpad Driver
steps.instruction: Device Manager → Mice and other pointing devices → Right-click touchpad → Update driver → Search automatically for drivers.

steps.title: Uninstall and Reinstall Driver
steps.instruction: Device Manager → Right-click touchpad → Uninstall device → Check 'Delete driver' → Restart computer (driver will auto-reinstall).

steps.title: Check for Physical Damage
steps.instruction: Ensure touchpad surface is clean and dry. Check if touchpad is physically damaged or if palm rejection is too sensitive.
